title: The never ending story around the ex-Chief Financial Officer Elias Motsoaledi Local Municipality.
text:
The never ending story around the ex-Chief Financial Officer Elias Motsoaledi Local Municipality.
First a full council consisting of 43 ANC members as far back as January 2015 decided that it had no other route to follow than to terminate the tenure of the Chief Financial Officer'Kaizer Monageng 'who had at the time only served 2 years of the 5 years contract that he had with council, over a misdemeanor of R 4 500, as being the only sensible route to follow.
When the CFO' Kaizer Monageng 'then challenged his termination of services in the CCMA Court and also in the High Court Council had no option but to employ legal representation in the matter which to date has cost the Council in excess of R 4 million to defend its actions of terminating the contract prematurely.
Legal Representation after lining his purse to the tune of R 4 million felt it appropriate to advise Council rather to settle the matter out of Court as an amicable resolution to the matter.
An intervention by the Regional Office of the ANC to try and mediate an amicable settlement came up with a settlement of 6 months pay and a voluntary resignation by the CFO was then the best that they could come up, which not only is deplorable but in actual fact an insult in to the intelligence, dignity and humanity of the CFO'Kaizer Monageng' that he has suffered in the process.
After having rejected the offer made to him, the Legal Representative of Council, now wants to contest the powers of the panel that shortlisted the applicants and conducted the interviews, and in this way try and justify that the panel had no jurisdiction to shortlist and or interview applicants for the position by innuendo declaring his employment as nil and void, how ludicrous!
If this is not bizarre or ridiculous to say this least then nothing in this world is.
Council is now paying a legal representative even more to defend the compilation of the committee as done by them, and to challenge it, ‘cutting off their noses to spite their faces’, and all at the cost of more legal representation and to try and justify that the appointment in the first instance was not legal.
The onus is on Council to compile a panel that has the jurisdiction and mandate to perform in this regard, and the onus would not be on the applicants to question the panel, if they have jurisdiction to act accordingly.
Should the Court rule that the Committee /Panel as appointed by Council, had no jurisdiction to shortlist and or interview applicants, it is Council that would end up with more ‘egg in its face’ and paying someone to even supply the egg!
When will they ever learn to just accept their mistakes that they made and Council, forcing all Councilors that were part and parcel of the initial decision and to incur legal costs to just ‘pay back the money’ as they obviously didn’t relialize the consequence of their actions at the time?
Let this be a lesson to them just not to just ‘rubber-stamp’ everything as they are dished up by people who don’t know nor realize that consequences of their actions.
